SEARCH
Module cqu.studentgradesystem
Package cqu.studentgradesystem

Class GradeAnalyser

java.lang.Object
cqu.studentgradesystem.GradeAnalyser
public class GradeAnalyser extends Object
The GradeAnalyser class provides functionality to analyze a data set of student records. It allows for:
  • Searching for a student by ID
  • Retrieving students within a specified total mark range
  • Validating mark range inputs
  • Computing class statistics like maximum, minimum, average, and median marks
The class uses both a list (for ordered access) and a hash table (for fast lookup). It also defines two inner record types for encapsulating range and validation results.
Author:
Ayush Bhandari StudentID S12157470

      public GradeAnalyser(DataSet data)
      Constructs a GradeAnalyser using a DataSet object. Initializes both the ordered list and the student hash table.
      Parameters:
      data - the dataset containing student information

    • GradeAnalyser

      public GradeAnalyser(Student[] students)
      Constructs a GradeAnalyser using a sorted array of Student records. Intended primarily for unit testing.
      Parameters:
      students - array of students sorted by total mark

      upper - the upper bound (inclusive)

    • validateRanges

      public GradeAnalyser.RangeValidationResponse validateRanges(String lowerStr, String upperStr)
      Validates user input strings representing mark bounds.

      Ensures that both fields are numeric, within range (0â€“100), and that the lower bound is not greater than the upper bound.

      Parameters:
      lowerStr - the input for the lower bound
      upperStr - the input for the upper bound
      Returns:
      a GradeAnalyser.RangeValidationResponse object indicating success or failure
